column1: #Text=Waterville is a small city on the Kennebec River , home to Colby College .
#Text=Because of its location along a former migration corridor between Quebec and New England ( now the Kennebec-Chaudière International Corridor ) , Franco-American culture is evident here .

#Text=Take US Interstate I-295 North through Brunswick ; this becomes I-95 North in Gardiner ; follow signs for Augusta , then Waterville ; Exit 127 for the Kennedy Memorial Drive which leads downtown ; trip is seventy-five miles and takes seventy-five minutes .
#Text=From Bangor : Take I-95 South ; Exit 130 for Main Street ; continue south on Main Street past the strip malls to downtown ; trip is 56 miles and takes about an hour .

#Text=From Quebec City : Take Autoroute 73 South to end ; Continue on Route 273 ( Route du President Kennnedy ) following signs for St. Georges/Frontier ; Jackman border crossing is open 24 hours/day 7 days/week ; continue south on US201 to downtown Waterville ; trip is 200 miles and takes about four hours .
#Text=Tickets can be purchased upon boarding or online from Greyhound The bus stops twice daily each way at by the local airport three miles southwest of downtown .
#Text=A community transportation service available to the general public , operates two bus routes through the city Monday to Friday .
#Text=A south line begins downtown and follows the Kennedy Memorial Drive and a north line runs between downtown and Fairfield .
#Text=Student-led campus tours available from the Office of Admissions .
#Text=A small liberal arts college founded in 1813 .
#Text=Stroll around the tree-studded hilltop campus with its fine Neo-Georgian architecture .

#Text=The view from the steps of Miller Library ( or from the library 's tower during the few times the tower is open ) stretches across the Kennebec River valley , particularly beautiful during fall foliage .
#Text=Maine 's largest art museum , containing important works by John Singleton Copley , Winslow Homer , Georgia O'Keeffe , and Richard Serra .
#Text=A 128 acre forest with almost two miles of hiking trails .
#Text=The city center 's architecture reflects the city 's textile mill past .
#Text=Several large mills remain standing but closed .

#Text=The 1903 Ticonic footbridge ( also called the Two Cent Bridge ) crosses the Kennebec between Waterville and neighboring Winslow , once allowing factory workers access to mills on either side of the river , now an interesting site to visit .
#Text=Memorial Day through Labor Day , Tuesday through Saturday .
#Text=Maintained by the Waterville Historical Society , this house contains 18th and 19th century artifacts from its original inhabitants and other local families .
#Text=In mid-July , this festival showcases independent American and international film and highlights New England and Maine filmmakers .
#Text=The college hosts musical and theatrical performances , sports , lectures , and many other cultural events .
#Text=Check the news and events page for listings .
#Text=One of Maine 's leading independent and international movie houses and venue for the Maine International Film Festival .
#Text=Art by local artists available for sale .
#Text=A grand theater space offering a variety of performances throughout the year .
#Text=Also a venue for the Maine International Film Festival .
#Text=Colby Bookstore , 5400 Mayflower Hill Dr ( in the Roberts Union ) , ☏ +1207 859-5400 , toll-free : +1-800-727-8506 .
#Text=Not only the source for college textbooks and all manner of Colby gear , this independent bookstore features Colby authors , books on local topics , and contemporary fiction and nonfiction .
#Text=Souvenirs and Maine-made products of all kinds , from Maine maple syrup to Maine-knit socks .
#Text=Aside from these recommendations , fast-food and other chain restaurants as well as supermarkets can be found along Main Street and the Kennedy Memorial Drive between I-95 and downtown .
#Text=Waterville location of a Maine ice cream chain headquartered in nearby Skowhegan .
#Text=Unique local flavors include Moose Tracks , Whoopie Pie , and Grape-nuts .
#Text=Waterville Farmers ' Market , Appleton Street ( the Concourse ) .
#Text=May-Oct Th 2PM-6PM ; Nov-Apr every third Th of month 2PM-4PM .
#Text=Farmers ' featuring a variety of locally grown , raised , or crafted products .
#Text=Coffee shop offering sandwiches , wine and gourmet treats .
#Text=Bar popular with both locals and college students .
#Text=They specialize in Breakfast and sandwiches and the portions are huge .
#Text=Do n't forget to try a whoopie pie !
#Text=Most accommodations ( chain hotels and motels ) are found along the Kennedy Memorial Drive and Main Street between I-95 and downtown .
#Text=In addition to the following recommendations , other country inns and bed and breakfasts are located nearby in Belgrade Lakes .
#Text=Budget Host Airport Inn , 400 Kennedy Memorial Dr , ☏ +1207 873-3366 , fax : +1207 873-3366 .
#Text=Offers breakfast and rooms with full kitchen suites .
#Text=Best Western Plus Waterville Grand Hotel , 375 Upper Main St , ☏ +1207 873-0111 .
#Text=Holiday Inn Express & Suites Waterville - North , 332 Main St , ☏ +1 207-873-2777 .
